subject: Gardening
title: Paths and Desire Lines
description: One-minute skill: Paths and Desire Lines.

hook.text: University campuses lay turf, then wait to see where students walk. The worn paths become the paved ones.

buildup.text: Desire lines are the paths people naturally choose. They reveal how humans actually want to move through space.

discovery.text: Paths that follow desire lines feel intuitive. Fight them and paths feel forcedâ€”people cut the lawn anyway.

twist.text: Designers sometimes redirect desire lines on purpose. A barrier or distraction can reveal hidden garden areas.

climax.text: Great path design respects natural movementâ€”then gently guides visitors toward experiences they'd otherwise miss.

punchline.text: The best paths follow where people already want to walk.

quiz.question: What is a 'desire line' in landscape design?
options: A decorative border that frames the main path
A path that people naturally choose to walk, regardless of planned routes
A sight line created to draw the eye toward a focal point
